titlestmt.titleproper: John Joseph and James F. Earley photographs and reproductions

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:33:52 -0400.

did.unittitle: John Joseph and James F. Earley photographs and reproductions

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs and reproductions of designs by James and John Earley for buildings in Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel 1271: An album of 25 photographs of a model of the Library of Congress with proposed designs; an album of 21 photographs of unidentified bas reliefs; and a book of reproductions of James Earley's carvings and sculptures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel 1202: Ca. 60 photographs and reproductions of models and sculpture for the Library of Congress, the Franciscan Monastery and other buildings in Washington, D.C.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 1202 and 1271 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sculptor, Manassas, Virginia. John Joseph Earley was a pioneer in the use of architectural concrete. Died 1945.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated 1976 by William Cron, via James Goode. Cron took this material from the Earley studio in Manassas, Virginia when it was being dismantled in 1973.
